# horizontal

**Instance Property**

The alignment on the horizontal axis.

## Declaration

```swift
var horizontal: HorizontalAlignment
```

## Discussion

Set this value when you initialize an alignment using the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Alignment/init(horizontal:vertical:)] method. Use one of the built-in [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/HorizontalAlignment] guides, like [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/HorizontalAlignment/center], or a custom guide that you create.

For information about creating custom guides, see [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AlignmentID].

## Creating a custom alignment

- **init(horizontal:vertical:)**: Creates a custom alignment value with the specified horizontal and vertical alignment guides.
- **vertical**: The alignment on the vertical axis.
